alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 5:27PM EDT until May 02 at 4:16AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Caribou ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River Above Dover-Foxcroft affecting Piscataquis County. For the Piscataquis River...including Blanchard, Dover-Foxcroft, Abbot, Medford...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Piscataquis River above Dover-Foxcroft. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Back Road in Abbot flooded. Floodwaters encroach on Guilford Recreational Fields. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 PM EDT Monday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 11.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.3 feet on 04/28/1973. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 430 AM EDT.
